FacilityName: Terra Nitrogen Limited Partnership, Blair Terminal

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
I.   Executive Summary
Introduction
The Terra Nitrogen Blair Terminal stores and ships out Anhydrous Ammonia and UAN Solutions. Ammonia is brought into the facility primarily by pipeline and shipped out primarily by truck.  UAN solution is brought into the facility by rail and truck and shipped out primarily by truck.  The regulated substance, as defined by 40 CFR Part 68, which is present at the facility in more than a threshold quantity is ammonia.

It is Terra Nitrogen's policy  to prevent accidental releases from the Blair Terminal by effective process safety management programs and procedures that include: participation by all plant employees in every element of PSM; maintaining current and accurate written operating procedures; providing timely and comprehensive training for all employees involved in operating and maintaining process equipment; overseeing the activities of contractors and ensuring that they are trained to perform their job safely; following established pre-startup safety review and management of change procedures to ensure that modifications are adequately evaluated for safety; administering a comprehensive mechanical integrity program to ensure that process equipment is maintained in accordance with good engineering practice and accepted industry standards; investigating incidents when they do occur to promptly correct deficiencies and learn from the experience; and audit the entire PSM program on a regular basis to verify that elements, procedures, and systems are in place and adequate.  In addition, it is the Blair Terminal's policy to maintain a current and accurate written emergency response plan, an equipped onsite emergency response team, a system to notify facility neighbors in the event of a release and to coordinate emergency response planning with local authorities and exercise those plans annually.

Accidental Release Prevention Program
The Blair Terminal has a comprehensive Process Safety Management (PSM) Program and is subject to the Occupational Safety and Health Administration's standard for process safety management of highly hazardous chemicals found at 29 CFR Part 1910.119.  Key elements of the PSM program include:  1) stringent design standards of equipment which incorporate substantial safety factors and include state of the art monitoring and control instrumentation; 2) extensive process safety information that is accurate and up to date; 3)  well trained operating, maintenance, and contractor personnel;  4) written operating and maintenance procedures;  5) mechanical integrity procedures for process equipment inspections and quality control;  6) management of change and pre-startup review procedures;  7) periodic, detailed evaluation of each process area by a team utilizing HAZOP methodology; and 8) regular audits of the entire PSM program.


Emergency Response Program
The Blair Terminal also has a comprehensive Emergency Response Program which includes a written plan that is coordinated with local authorities, and an emergency notification system that utilizes both in-plant sirens and the Industrial Coop Alert Network telephone system.  The Blair Terminal has also contracted with Community Alert Network (C.A.N.) to provide an emergency telephone notification system for alerting neighbors in the affected area in the event of a release.
